newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Prempharm rises on Adcock merger.
newsitem.headline: Prempharm rises on Adcock merger.

text.p: Premier Pharmaceutical Company Ltd shares rose on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on Friday on news that it had been bought by competitor Adcock Ingram.
Dealers and analysts welcomed the news saying the merger of the two operations would provide the new company with the necessary critical mass in the pharmaceutical industry.
"The market is taking well the idea of building a pharmaceutical giant," a dealer said.
An analyst who declined to be identified said: "I think they both needed (the deal) to sustain future earnings growth."

By the close Prempharm shares had jumped 80 cents or 4.17 percent to 24.80 after a volume of 38,300 shares valued at just over a million rand changed hands. Shares earlier touched a best level of 25 rand but had slipped on profit-taking, dealers said.
Adcock Ingram announced on Thursday it had bought 100 percent of the Prempharm Company with effect from May 1, 1996 -- thereby merging the two operations.
Analysts said Prempharm shareholders would stand to benefit more from the merger than Adcock shareholders.
"It is positive in the longer term, those who will gain are Prempharm shareholders," said Melanie da Costa, pharmaceutical analyst at Investec Securities.
"I expect Adcock shares to trade sideways for a while," she said.
Adcock shares ended the day 20 cents firmer at 19.40 rand in thin volume trade.
